body_content.explanation: a style of singing with a guttural quality (= produced at the back of the throat). Different traditional forms of throat singing are practised in various places across the world, for example in parts of Central Asia:
examples: In Tuva on the border with Mongolia the old tradition of throat singing has been revived.

body_content.explanation: a performance or game in the Inuit culture in which two people, usually women, stand opposite each other making a series of deep sounds with their voices or breath, to see who can carry on the longest:
examples: The two women faced each other nearly nose to nose and began their throat singing.
